intro: Braxilia, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically has heart-shaped leaves and produces striking blue or purple blooms. Braxilia thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as a decorative vine. Its seeds are encased in a fleshy, orange-red fruit that splits open when mature.
